name: braciola
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a dish that consists of thin slices of meat, rolled up with cheese, herbs, and breadcrumbs (= very small pieces of dry bread), or served in a tomato sauce : The chef's regional Italian dishes include braciola from Campania. There were meatballs, sausage, and braciole in the bubbling pot of red sauce.
More examplesFewer examplesTo assemble each braciola: spread the cutlet with butter or olive oil, then roll it with the mixture inside and secure with two toothpicks.I highly recommend the spinach ricotta agnolotti and the braciole over creamy polenta.She makes her own braciola, the flattened beef that she spreads with parsley, garlic, salt and pepper, rolls up, and then braises.
